page.title: 10Business and Trade: Adisham
page.content: Industry in Adisham is confined to a chalkpit near Bekesbourne employing six men. The chalk is used for agriculture and flints to repair Canterbury city walls. There is a wholesale warehouse on the old marshalling yard employing twelve men and eight women. It sells industrial connections, made up to order, protective clothing and leisure wear. Goods are bought in by their own transport, which is serviced out- side. There is also a pumping station. Several people in the village run one- person businesses. There is a plumber, hairdresser, electrician, carpenter, car-bumper maker and builder; with furniture design studio at Bossington. The village shop provides a post office, dry cleaning agency, and all essential foods. It sells newspapers, wine, and assorted items, delivers to the elderly, and acts as a focal point.
